title: Patrick Mahomes throws for 116 yards in one drive for Chiefs
text:
CLOSE

In his bid to win NFL MVP honors for a second consecutive season, Patrick Mahomes is doing what might seem like a mathematical impossibility until closer inspection.

The Kansas City Chiefs quarterback left many double-checking their own stats on Sunday when he threw for 116 yards on his team's first drive against the Houston Texans.

The Chiefs started the series at their own 9-yard line, which would seemingly limit the yardage opportunity for Mahomes to 91. But three penalties — an offensive pass interference, false start and holding — pushed back Kansas City a total of 25 yards.

Mahomes did most of his damage on two plays: a short pass that running back Darrel Williams took for 52 yards and a 42-yard scoring strike to wide receiver Tyreek Hill, who was playing in his first game since sustaining a shoulder injury in Week 1.

Mahomes was coming off a 19-13 loss to the Indianapolis Colts that represented the lowest scoring output for the Chiefs since the quarterback became the team's starter in 2018.

description: Patrick Mahomes is doing what might seem mathematically impossible by throwing or 116 yards in a single drive for the Kansas City Chiefs.
